stimulusHtml:
"Inde lupae fulvo nutricis tegmine laetus
 Romulus excipiet gentem et Mavortia condet
 moenia Romanosque suo de nomine dicet.
 His ego nec metas rerum nec tempora pono:
5imperium sine fine dedi. Quin aspera Iuno,
 quae mare nunc terrasque metu caelumque fatigat,
 consilia in melius referet, mecumque fovebit
 Romanos, rerum dominos gentemque togatam."

Aeneid 1. 275-282

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. What are the case and use of lupae (line 1) ?

2. In lines 1-3 (Inde . . . dicet), (A) which three Latin words explain the source of the Romansâ€™ name. (B) Translate them in context.

3. (A) Identify one and only one literary device in line 4 (His . . . pono) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it.

4. (A) What is the case of His (line 4) and (B) to which one Latin word does it refer?

5. In this passage, which three Latin words indicate the unlimited authority granted by Jupiter to the Romans?

6. What are the case and use of consilia (line 7) ?

7. Briefly explain the importance to the Romans of the phrase gentem togatam (line 8). Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.
